I had spoonfuls and I was impressed.  Turns out my cousin is allergic to all fish so he had a steak.  Not a grass fed piece of foodie heaven, but I don't think he's fussy.  My fried scallops seemed to be of the frozen breaded type but they were sweet and I wanted deep fried comfort that night.  The Parmesan Halibut was very tasty and moist.  The tuna was cooked to order and the wasabi butter was tasty.  Filet of Sole was my mom's choice and it was quite good.  Big fries (chips) real potatoes and plenty of flavor, just as I remembered, but the rice never did it for me.  A great meal for the price if you choose the right components.       
 The wait is worth it because being trapped in a fog cloaked vestibule drinking Chablis with strangers is a Westie experience that can't be reproduced elsewhere.  I really hope PC (crap, I hate those initials) outlives me -- and I'm going to live a really long time.
author: Susan P.

description: Whenever someone I know is going to SF, I tell them to come here.  Of course the Pacific Cafe isn't the best food, let alone seafood, that you can get in SF - but none of that matters b/c after downing several glasses of complimentary white wine - anything will taste fine.  I can't think of another restaurant where I am happy to wait for 2+ hours to get a table.  Good times.
author: Thomas S.

description: I came on a Monday night and for once there was not a huge wait.  Despite being seated right away, they still gave us our complimentary glass of wine (and it's a very full glass!).  I ordered the halibut, which was quite good.  My dining partner ordered the sand dabs, which were light, flaky, and delicious.  All of the portions were ginormous.  I would be a feat for a competitive eater to finish all of the food they put in front of you.  Overall, I would say the food's good, but too heavy.  Even though it's seafood, the amount of cream and oil they pour over everything takes any hope of a healthy dinner away.  This old school restaurant takes you back to the time of dining when we didn't know, or didn't care to know, what caused heart attacks.
author: Jen H.

description: Both times that I've been here the wait was so long that it was a challenge not to be completely drunk by the time we were seated.  ( I guess it's hard for me to turn down free wine.)  The crabcakes are darn tasty, though.
author: Nat K.

description: This place is sooooooo cute. Thank you Yelpers for letting me in on a 'secret' San Francisco institution. The seafood is dynamite. Portions are large enough for two people to share. The oyster bisque is tasty. Be prepared to wait. The wine and comfortable crowd makes the wait worthwhile
author: Sherie R.

description: The big deal here is free vino while waiting.  remember what free costs?  one of my favourite astrophysics professors Dr. Stephen Gregory would say-- there is no free lunch-- he meant in relationship to gravity-- i know it seems lightyears away from what we are talking about.  you pay for the "free" vino--it is not something that you can write home about.  life is too short for bad wine.  i'll pay-- a nominal fee can pay for better wine.  the seafood here was not as i expected -- i wanted hard-to-find amazingly well prepared seafood-- it seemed ordinary and nothing special about the entree or side servings.  i have only been here once and i can picture when i will be back.
author: Jaime Patricio M.

description: It's expensive and good seafood but that's not really the point of my review.  People actually try to time going here for when the wait will be longest.  You can be sloppy drunk for free by the time you get a table.  Enough said.
author: M M.

description: This place is a very well kept San Francisco secret! From the outside, it just looks like another tiny San Francisco restaurant, but on the inside, it's heaven... The seafood is freaking awesome!!! Everytime. No exceptions. I have never heard anyone complain about the food here ever... Sometimes the wait can suck, but they give you free white wine while you wait, and it's worth the wait! Definately check this place out!
author: Lindsey S.

description:
oh its nice here. the evening ambiance is wonderful with the plentiful free wine as you wait. sure, youre more than likely going to wait most nights, and a lengthy amount of time at that, but by the time youre seated, youll be nice and inebriated

the food is great, and the staff is cheery. definitely a good spot for seafood and socializing.
author: Darrell L.

description:
Alright, I'm not gonna sit here and claim to be a seafood connoisseur, in fact, I'm usually not the biggest fan in the first place.  So I'll make this simple...
1) My cousin from back east was visiting and all we had to do was hop the 38 Geary to get to and from Pacific Cafe (I don't have a car - and we knew we'd be drinking - not that you care why I took the bus).  
2) I knew they didn't take reservations, so it was pretty awesome to get free wine while waiting for a table.  Only made the conversation and catching up that much more friggin' hilarious.
3) I had Parmesan Crusted Halibut.  Like I said, I usually am not a huge seafood fan, and I just drooled on my keyboard reminiscing about this meal.
4) Service was great... from what I remember.
5) Both my cousin and I loved the place, down to the accessibility, the ambiance, and of course, the free wine - even if it isn't great.  Anything free these days is appreciated.  

Definitely a fun place to take out of town friends and visitors.  Feels very SF to me.
author: Matt L.

description: Husband and I came here for our 3 month wedding anniversary last night, and boy were my fellow yelpers right on point - I LOVE this place! Pacific Cafe is now my go-to seafood spot - why? Because it is officially my favorite for its fresh, fresh food, great service and ambiance. Who can say no to free wine (all of you under 21 should)? Fresh bread and butter, and those crab cakes was like taking a bite of bliss every single time. If it weren't for dinner and the fact that they carried Zanze's cheesecake for dessert, I would have gotten more! I had one of their specials, the spicy snapper. It was more of a kick than spicy which actually worked out well considering my episode of acid reflux. Husband had the calamari steak and we were both very, very content with our orders. I love how all of the orders comes with either soup or salad, fries, rice or red potatoes. A nice hearty meal for a cold day in the city. I had their shrimp louie salad, and it was delicious. The salad was fresh, and the husband enjoyed his clam chowder. Like I said, they had Zanze's cheesecake, which we ordered without hesitation. I loved how they carried local foods (they also have Mitchell's ice cream), so we felt the SF pride in there. We only live 10 blocks away, so it won't be hard for us to come back! Yummy, yummy crab cakes, I need some more!
author: Ang L.

description: went here for dinner last friday night. it was finally time after many recommendations and seeing it on check please. we got there around 6 and it was packed. not abad thing, because they are very generous with their free wine while you wait offering. healthy sized portions and fairly tasty. only beef is that its way over-priced. i forget what the missus had but it was like 26 bucks for "rice pilaf" and her fish. i had the cajun snapper and was satisfied. there was enough left for lunch the next day, and that was solid tasting after the re-heat.
author: aidan m.

description: This is my favorite seafood fish restaurant.  I love how they have free complimentary wine when you get seated.  There is usually a line so make sure you come early, late, or expect to wait a while.  My favorite fish is their petrale sole with their delicious salty capers.  They used to have this delicious cup of oysters for an appetizer, but the last time I went, they instead served the oysters whole on a platter instead, so I will have to try it again to see if that is permenant.  I don't think they can go wrong with fish.  I remember also ordered red snapper with some spices and that was delicious as well.
author: John L.

description: Always a line, kind of out of the way, but some of the best seafood around. Very simple preparation styles, nothing fancy, but oh so good. If it's really busy and you are left waiting outside, they give you complimentary wine while you wait!
author: April M.

description: When going out for seafood this is the place I end up at in SF.  It has very fresh and tasty seafood dishes.  Arrive early or come late otherwise you can wait up to an hour.  Don't worry they liquor you up with free wine as you wait :)
author: Michelle M.

description:
Everytime we celebrate our Anniversary or any special occassion, we always look for a nice restaurant. We had dinner here last year for our Anniversary. All I can say that the food was great and the price is reasonable. We didn't have any problems with their service and the food is great. I think I had their Halibut entree (if I remember it correctly) and that was great ;)

So all in all, I'm giving this "off the hook 5 stars" rating and highly recommend it.
author: JM M.

description: Great old school joint. Of course the wine while you wait is a nice touch, but the food is the highlight here. We started with the Oyster Cocktail, which came with cocktail sauce and horseradish. There were so many oysters that we couldn't finish them all. Next came the Salmon Bisque and the Clam Chowder. Both were spicy, but the Bisque was my favorite. Silky smooth with a nice amount of salmon chunks. The chowder was hearty and spicy as well, but not really what I was looking for. The main courses were all delicious. Tombo Tuna was prepared like your normal Ahi Tuna, but served with a Wasabi butter and it just melted in your mouth. The baked halibut was great as well, as the outer crust was perfectly cooked. The salmon was pretty good too. Overall I'd have to recommend this place to anyone that enjoys friendly service in a small cozy neighborhood restaurant at a leisurely pace...
author: Nicolas H.

description:
I'm always looking for good seafood places in the City and often end up going to Japanese restaurants, but this time I remembered Pacific Cafe.  Arrived at 7:20pm on a  Saturday night and the place is packed with a ton of people outside with glasses of wine in hand.  The adorable host who reminds me family took our name and said, "The wait is 1 hour, don't worry, I'll bring you wine."  2 hours 20 mins, 5 glasses of wine, and 17 games of Bubble Breaker later our table is ready.  Now mind you I wasn't super hungry when I got there and at this point still not famished, but my fingers are a tad numb from the SF eve and playing the little game (minor details) As everyone was willing to wait, I didn't seem to mind.  The host gave me some hot water to warm my little fingers.  Once we sat down the food arrived really fast and it was dang tasty.  Entrees we had - crab cakes (2 cd size cakes!) and the parmesean crusted halibut with the boudin unlimited bread, soup and rice pilaf.  Oh and the lemon bar for dessert.  Flipping fantastic stuff!  Servings are enough for 2 meals, seriously.

So alas - I glanced at the review prior to coming so I remembered to order the parmesean crusted halibut and the free wine, but I forgot about the wait.  I'd recommend coming early or putting your name on the list and taking a nice stroll through the Richmond to work up your appetite.  The Legion of Honor is a block away!  Service and food are awesome.  So very happy I have found a seafood place so tasty and well priced.
author: Denice L.

description: Very delicious and Fun. Yes, you get wine while you wait, so it's not that bad--and when I was there, there were about 10 parties in front of us, but the line moved fairly fast--we probably waited 30-45 minutes. The Pescatore Dore was very good, and my friend ordered the fried scallops--equally as good, but both very rich! Oh, and the crab cocktail was delish (in season), and so was the clam chowder. I definitely recommend this place--cute and not in the 'ordinary' neighborhood that I usually hang out in, which I liked!
author: michaela w.

description: Great seafood spot with a cozy atmosphere...one of those places you can always fall back on and take a couple friends that are in town. They serve you complimentary wine while you wait (which could take up to an hour if you go at peak hours on the weekend), and the food is delicious and well priced.
author: Chris L.

description: I have lived on 38th and Geary for over a year and half now and I still hadn't tried this place.  Why I ask myself?  Driving up Geary I always see tons of people waiting outside drinking the free wine they give you while you wait.  It is soooooo worth the wait.  I had the salmon bisque (which I am still dreaming about), and the Parmesan crusted halibut.  Man oh man, I am so glad I live four blocks away because I will definitely be back!  I have never tried oysters because they kind of freak me out.  However my boyfriend had fried oysters and they were amazing.  Although I still don't think I could ever have raw oysters.  I recommend this place because it is all locals who come here.  No tourists, and I love that.  The food is fresh, the staff is extremely friendly, and the food is just down right solid.
author: Samantha R.

description: I've lived around the corner since 2004, but somehow never made it to this place until last month.  It won't take me that long to go back.  I tried a bit of every plate that came to our table and it was all excellent.
author: Christian D.

description: Would have given a five star because of the clam chowder alone, but it is irritating when the couple behind you gets the last table for two as your husband is meeting you at that exact moment. The forty five minute wait (I should have asked for a table for one and been seated right away) was bearable because of the free but kind of bad wine - but it was cold out so what the heck. The clam chowder is not cream based and oh-so-yummy. Nicely spicy with white pepper. The parmesan crusted halibut is good but I would try something else next time. This is a staple of the Avenues and still about the same quality as when I lived out there in the 80s. Nothing fancy but pretty decent food.
author: Theresa C.

description: This is a place to go when you just want an inexpensive night out with a complimentary glass of white wine. Old school seafood that is not great, but the fog reminds you that you live by the bay. The serving staff is just really down to earth which alone I would give 5 stars. They are not the ones from Walnut Creek with horrible attitude and bad service. The staff here knows that people return here because they are loved.
author: miriam b.

description: This place does seafood right, fresh seafood not covered up with ridiculous sauces, or marinades.  Be prepared to wait, they will provide you with free wine, but remember the wait is worth it, well worth it!
author: Cassie L.

description: This place is definitely over rated. The food was good, but not that good to get a five star rating. Sauces for the seafood was too over powering and you cannot taste the fish. I think shrimp and crab should never be baked together with any fish. The flavors of the shrimp and crab would cancel out and overpower the fish. What's the point of having fish when it taste like crab? They serve the thick base clam chowder soup and it was alright. I personally like the watery clam chowder soup. Nothing special about the appetizers. Would I come here again? No, there are much better seafood places I rather go.
author: HUNG L.

description:
It lives up to the hype!

Total gem of a seafood place in the Richmond area. Great place to go at night with friends to drink free wine while waiting for a table and watching kitties begging for scraps out back.

I had the Ahi Tuna with Wasabi butter which tasted fantastic. Almost feels like you are eating tuna sashimi. A friend got the halibut with Parmesan cheese crust which was AMAZING! I don't know why or how, but one bite of that and suddenly there was a PARTY in my mouth!

Portions are huge, we all really had to pack it in to clean our plates. Prices are high as well though, expect to pay $30/person after tax & tip.
author: M. W.

description: Great Seafood here. It's worth the trek out to Outer Richmond.They have an ever changing daily menu. The decor screams 1975 and the place is tiny. Get there before it opens at 5pm because it fills up quickly. Oh, while you wait, they serve you free wine. Can't be that! My fiancee and I both enjoyed a Salmon and Crab casserole dish that had melted Cheddar on top and whole boiled potatoes on the side.
author: Mike P.

description:
Okay.. I decided to try this place out because it always seems to be crowded on Friday nights.  I have lived in the Richmond district almost all of my life and I have never tried this place out.  Anyways, it really depends on what you order.  I agree with some of the reviews that the some of the orders just plain suck, like my wife's ahi tuna had no flavor at all with just side of wasabi mayo. 

My order on the other hand was pretty good, I had the parmesian crusted halibut.  A little expensive for what you get though.  I probably won't eat here again but I give it 3 stars.
author: Ethan C.

description: Free wine while you wait, tipsy when you sit. Order from the special board, I had the baked halibut and it was delicious! Dinner came with a choice of salad. Their portion was huge! Great place to bring a date unless she doesn't drink ;)
author: Daniel W.

description: Pacific Cafe has been one of my top five favorite restaurants for the past 15 years.  I have never, ever had a bad meal here.  The wait staff are all great - especially Roy.  Roy wears many hats at Pacific Cafe.  Some nights he is in the host role and some nights he is back in the kitchen cooking.  I believe he has worked here for close to 30 years.  I love that they serve complimentary wine while you wait.  Waiting and drinking the lovely wine just serves to enhance the whole experience of the restaurant.  Just know that if you arrive during prime time dining on a Friday or Saturday night, you will probably have to wait at least an hour.
author: Lisa L.

description: One of my favorite places to eat in the neighborhood.  I usually go during the week to avoid the crowds and it's crowded for good reason.  Warm welcome with the complimentary wine, fresh sourdough to start and the fish is consistently good. Recommended.
author: Doug K.

description: I've been here only 3 times and each one was magnificent. I really need to go more often but I like to save gems for special occasions. The food is absolutely scrumptious. They do seafood in a number of different ways and each one (that I've tried) is very tasty. It's a popular place so you may have to wait in line but it's worth it. They give you free wine as you wait! The atmosphere is cozy - a perfect neighborhood joint. Definitely check this place out.
author: Carter F.

description: I'm torn on this place.  The food was pretty good (try the baked Halibut with parmesan cheese) and I like the private booth seating but the wait is too freakin' long!  It took almost an hour to be seated and a little too long once we were seated to have our orders taken.  The service is friendly but they should consider having more staff on hand.  Maybe I'll try going again when I'm not as hungry since I won't get to eat for almost 2 hours.
author: Miss Purr fec t.

description: I actually was a little dissapointed with the seafood here as it was nothing special.  The food is definitely very fresh but it wasnt prepared in a way where it was to die for.  The service is really friendly, one of the best I have experienced and the complimentary wine for the wait is a plus.  This is a place you would go to if you craved seafood prepared in a home style method.
author: Charles C.

description: I went with three other girls and we got the steamer clams, mahi mahi, ahi with wasabi butter and crab cakes.  Everything was fantastic, except maybe the clam chowder.  It tasted more like chicken noodle than clam chowder.  Lots of house wine of course and tons of sourdough bread/butter.  Definitely a great place to take seafood lovers but a little pricey for what you get, I think.
author: Jacquie M.

description:
I first learned about Pacific Cafe on one of those Local Access shows (I think it was Around the Bay or something) and i immediatley wanted to try it.  Im constantly going to SF from the east bay and am always looking for good places to eat.  So yesterday was my mom's birthday, so i took my parents there.

We spotted it around 4:30, but spent about 15 minutes looking for parking (definatley give yourself time) and walked a short 2 blocks back up to the resteraunt.  It was about 4:45, but there were already about 10 people waiting in line! After we got there, about 6 more people got in line behind us! The free wine wasn't great tasting, but if you want a cheap buzz, it will do.  No complaints here. 

The crowd in front of us was definatley older, probably 65+ but hey, I like old people, theyre cute! but the line behind us was a little younger, 40+ (then there was me, 22 with my parents...I felt like a kid) 

The menu is short and sweet, and the speacials are written on the blackboard and on a litle white board the waiter brings around to you.  For apetizers we all had clam chowder (the soup or salad was included in our dinners because we all got daily speacials) and a Crab cocktail and a Bay Shrimp cocktail.  (We like to eat :-))  Before our apetizers came, we ate the most delicious SF sourdough bread, not so sour that it makes you suck in your cheeks, but with a hint of that puckery taste.  With soft butter it was DELICIOUS.  They kept bringing more, but try not to eat alot! Portions are pretty good here.

The clam chowder was so good, but different than typical chowders.  A thinner soup, with a touch of spice really hit our tummies well.  

The wait staff is SO attentive, constantly filling your water/soda/wine etc and taking away all the used plates and silverware as soon as you put them down.  It sound hurried, but you can tell theyre just trying to make your time more enjoyable.  There are no suits and ties in this place, Track jackets, Jeans and Teva's (with socks hehe) was the dress code.  Very relaxed and casual.  

Our dinner arrived! In perfect time...I ordered the Grilled Jumbo Prawns, and for me it was perfect.  Im very picky and I hate sauces, creams, etc.  They came plain, just butterflied inshell prawns with melted butter and some french fries, grilled perfectly.  Four prawns was definatley enough food.  Unfortunatley the french fries wernt very good, but my Dad liked them, so maybe it was just me.  

My mom ordered the Crab Cakes, two HUGE cakes, 80% crab!!! She could only finish one and barely a half.  She was very satified to say the least.

My dad ordered the Ahi tuna with Wasbi butter, which he said was soooo delicious, and for those who dont like Wasabi...or butter... it comes on the sidde in a little cup so you can try and put it on as you like, a big plus for us.  

Desert was 2 pieces of cheesecake, and chocolate chip ice cream for me.  The cheesecake was plain, no nonsense, just deliciously light cheesecake, perfect for anyone who is a fan of plain NY cheesecake.  Two huge scoops of ice cream which I couldn't even finish.  Neverthe less it was delicious, just like everything else.


I would DEFINATLEY recommend Pacific Cafe for anyone looking for a good meal, anyday of the week.  They aren't open for lunch, but they open every day at 5PM and start turning people away at 10 to hopefully cloe around 1030.  Not for night owls, or kids, unless your kids eat shellfish, steak (they have one New York Strip available on the menu)  or other fish.  Do vegetarians eat fish? I dont know, but if you dont eat fish or beef, dont go, they dont have a vegetarian option as an entree (but they might be able to work something out with a salad or... somthing)  Also, they can accomadate parties of 8 in a booth, but any bigger and i think you would be turned away.  Also i didnt see any high chairs, and only 1 table (mainly booths) so if your larger person try sitting in the booth before they make it your permanent table, my dad is a about the size of a running back, and only had a teeny bit of room between him and the table, which are totally stationary in the booths.

Be ready to lighten your wallet at the end, but I think it was a fair price, $120 not including tip for the freshest, tastiest sea food ive tasted in a long time ad great service.  We gave a 20% tip because we were so pleased with everything, so it came out to be $50 per person including tip (without any cocktails or wine besides the free stuff)

A great place to eat!  The end.
author: Mandi C.

description: Free white wine while you wait is great, but while you can get stuck in a line time flys when when you have a drink in hand. The service is good the food has never let me down. Very hearty and traditional seafood. I've even been lucky enough to go when they have had abalone. The Pacific Cafe feels old school and that is what it is, a true classic neighborhood  seafood restaurant.
author: Charles O.

description: Very good restaurant. I love this place. Everyone is soooo friendly, even the people who are waiting to eat. Very hard to find parking but that's SF. Just talking writing about this place makes me want to go there. We live about 4 blocks from Pacific Cafe.  A great place for fresh seafood. A place to take someone who is visiting SF. So far that is what we have done and everyone we have taken to this place, they also loved it. It's  great to go right when it is opening so that you don't have to wait. If you are the first to be seated you still get a glass of free wine, We did. If you come later it's a long wait but if you sip wine then it does not seem like you are waiting long.  The CRAB CAKE, SALMON, SCALLOP, ABALONE, SPICY SNAPPER, SHRIMP LOUIE SALAND AND THERE SOUPS ETC and very good. They do have Steak but I have never tired it. The waiters are all very nice.
author: Ge I.

description: This is an amazing seafood restaurant! It's a tiny little place that hasn't changed much since it opened in the 70s (according to my parents). The seafood is amazing, especially the fresh salmon, swordfish, and halibut. The crab cakes are also delicious. Just plan to wait, as it's a small, popular place. But as the other yelpers have said, they serve you wine while you wait, so it certainly makes waiting a whole lot more fun! A timeless San Francisco landmark!
author: Carissa A.

description: One of my favorites. Get there at 4:50pm and wait for the 10 minutes. You will get a free glass of wine while you wait. If you get there after 5pm be prepared to wait. I love the abalone with red potatoes. You get choice of salad (2 types) and soup. I like the Ceasar my wife and kids do the shrimp salad. The calamari app. is great.(its not deep fried but has a vinegar dressing)They used to do great lobster tails but I havent had one in a while. My kids like the prawn scampi. The mixed grill fish is also great. We go there at least 6 times a year.
author: mike k.

description: So sometimes you have a bit of a wait, since they don't take reservations, but to help make the time go by they give you free wine (there's been a few times where I've gotten a little tossed on the free wine before I even got a table). The waiters are always friendly and knowledgeable about their selections for the day, and the fish is always fresh and amazing. I've been here at least 20 times and I've never had a bad experience.
author: Melissa B.

description: They don't take reservations, so there's always a wait.  Usually expect to wait half an hour at dinner time around 7 or 8 if not more.  But to quiet the screeching sounds of your hungry belly, they give you free wine while you wait! Ok it's not a chateau blanc from '65 (or other default old wine name), but it's not bad.  The menu is great, all the fresh seafood favorites you like, some depending on season, and you get clam chowder or salad, with the meal, included.  Recommend the rainbow trout or the steaming pot of mussels.
author: Raffi Y.

description:
Average, average, average... Judging by the crowds waiting for a table, you would think that the food would be over the top.  Sadly, I have to say that the food was just mediocre. Entrees are usually accompanied by a soup or salad.  The soup was good. Salad was nothing to write home about.  Bread was served cold.

Crab cakes were oily and flavorless. Ahi Tuna was good, but you really can't mess tuna up if you're just searing it.

Also, do not take your kids here unless they love seafood. There are no kids menus.
author: katherine l.

description: I have been going here for 13 years and always have a great experience. I think it is mostly due to the free wine they serve outside. We always hope for a long wait so we get two glasses. By the time we are seated we are pleasantly toasty and ready to eat. The food really isn't spectacular, but it's good. The fish is always fresh and tasty. I like the garlicky scampi and my partner usually goes for the catch of the day. try to get here around 7:30 for the maximum (free wine!) wait. It is the only place where the wait doesn't irritate the crap out of me.
author: Marcia B.

description: I really enjoyed my food here. we were seated right away which was unusual because this place always has a line out the door whenever i tried to eat here. I was lucky that night around 6:30, my dad and I got a nice big table right away. they gave my dad a free glass of wine. i ordered the calamari vinagrette for appetizer and the turbo fish and shrimp louis salad. dad ordered the louisiana shrimp with same salad. everything was really good. i had some of my dads shrimp and my fish was especially good. I think the best part of the restaurant was the SERVICE. the service here is one of the best i ever experienced. the waiter was prompt and the water girl always refilled my water at least 5 times. and took my plate right when i was done. that is what i call service. then we had the mango sorbet and cheesecake which was soo good.
author: Cory Y.

description: This place is good. The free wine as you wait is great. Sea food is ok. Can be a long wait to get in so, sip your wine you might get too drunk. and is expensive, not a everyday place.
author: william w.

description: So the food is pretty good, not fabulous, the wine is like way not spectacular, but the fact that its free and flows abundantly, hey now! This is the place to be! Yeah, you get all the wine you can drink before you get seated while waiting, inside or out, for your table. This strategy leads to gross over ordering, consuming massive amounts of bread and butter while spending 3 solid months on a low carb diet where you forgot the taste of bread and butter, and not caring while you consume mass quantities because you're so hammered you considered chewing on the potted pines outside. This leads to praising the food which is ok, not amazing, but definitely solid every time, to being the best damned fish I ever did have, as you snap up some french fries unaware that you were actually eating scallops which your friend said were prawns because he was as drunk as you are and nearly stabbed himself in the eye with his fork. Yes, this is a standard Friday night at Pacific Cafe, go with caution friends... caution I say.
author: Len S.

description: The food here is great! The fish is very fresh and nicely prepared. All the waiters, servers, and greeters are very friendly. And the free wine is an excellent touch!!
author: L T.

description: I had Pacific Cafe reccomended by a friend.  The place seems to always have a pretty steady flow of people, and you definetly can't complain about the glasses of wine for free while you wait for a table to open up. Good selection of fish, all nicely done. The calamari was not fried but ?marinated/? but it was very tasty, and a nice change from your standard fried calamari. Though the best fried calamari by far, is at Cafe Maritime on Lombard.  Good service and good fish.
author: Jeffrey S.

description:
ate here on our recent trip to sf.  first off, let me say that the free wine is a nice thought, but the wine is just awful.  

that being said, we had a great dinning experience.  the wait on a latish sat. nite was only a few minutes longer than it took for me to find a parking space after dropping my wife off.  the waitress was efficient tho not particularly friendly, but that doesn't matter to me as long as the food is good, and the food was good.  we had the excellent crabcakes (crabby and not too greasy).  i had the generous portion of sand dabs, which were delicious, and my wife had the parmesan halibut, which was great too.  the red potatoes only taste good if you fry them for breakfast the next day, but the fries were good.  all and all, i'd go back when next we visit
author: joel r.

description: Fantastic low key place.  I love it I'm there with friends outside drinking the free wine watching the fog roll in waiting for the fantastic fish dinner.  I have been going here for years and always recommend it to friends
author: James D.

description:
This place is like stepping back in time ... to a fish restaurant of days gone by. I dont think the menu has changed much since they opened in 1974, luckily there are a few real gems on it!

A welcoming, unpretentious old san francisco atmosphere and veteran servers greet you with as much cheap white wine as you can guzzle before you are seated. The booths are comfortable and feel somewhat intimate - great for either a date or a few good friends.

Some of the dishes I have had have been just OK, but the following makes up for it:

The Halibut Parmesan is freaking amazing! I had never had it before I tried it here but I come back regularly just for this dish.

When they have it, the Crab Bisque is fantastic in all of its calorific glory!

Great sourdough bread to soak up the wine before food arrives!

Come here for good seafood traditionally prepared and good times over several glasses of wine. 

Don't come here for a salad, or vegetables or anything that doesnt involve a giant slab of fish!
author: Aaron F.

description: My boyfriend and I have nicknamed this place "Vino!" because we're all for the free wine and getting that nice little "happy" buzz before dinner.  Of course, we also like the food because it's always fresh and tasty.  Our favorites are the crab cakes and the Parmesan halibut.  We've always had pleasant service there plus it's in our 'hood.
author: Michelle E.

description: When you arrive, there is often a line, but waiting isn't so bad since they serve you complimentary wine.  The wait staff is terrific and the food is delicious!  The parmesan encrusted halibut is the BEST dish.  Atmosphere is casual and friendly.
author: Garrett H.

description: This is the worst Seafood Restaurant I have ever been.  My god. I ordered the ahi tuna while i ordered the halibut.  both were bland.  it didn't have any taste to it.  I ended up having a stomachache when I got home.  the food was expensive too. I was so mad when the bill came up to be over $70! totally not worth it. I will never go back to this place again even though IF it's ever for free!
author: Jason W.

description: I found this restaurant on yelp, and from all the great reviews my husband and I decided to try it out for our anniversary dinner in the City.  We were very impressed that everything was as reviewers had predicted.  We arrived at 4:20 and waited outside until 4:45, when the door was opened and we were invited to move inside to wait in chairs.  Then complimentary wine was brought out to everyone in line.  Seating was prompt, and despite everyone being seated at once, there were plenty of servers and order taking was fast, and food arrived quickly.  We were very pleased with our experience.
author: Lacy B.

description: one of the near and dear places to my heart. i've been going there for the past 10 + years and my parents have been going there since the place opened in 1974. imagine that. must be more than just decent to stick around in the heart of the fogbelt for 30 years. for the past ten years i've been requesting pretty much the same thing - some sort of chowder, tuna and wasabi, wedge cut french fries, sourdough bread (where do they find this stuff?!!??!) and of course, who can pass up the free wine. my head is usually spinning by the time i rip into the bread. and then of course after all that wine, who could possibly think about being frozen head to toe.
author: Liz R.

description: The bubbly provided as you're waiting is sweet & a thoughtful touch of customer service rarely seen, but the food is quite lackluster. I ordered the sand dabs that were overly-fried and tasted only so-so. The sides were massively unappealing & greasy vegetable pieces. Even the vanilla ice cream dessert tasted grainy. The total for 2 came to about $70. It was so not worth it!
author: Judy H.

description: what a disappointment. worst seafood in my life. the clam chowder taste like chicken noodle soup. that's all i can remember, everything else my friend and i ordered we did not even finish it. would never come back here.
author: Karen H.

description: Awesome! You get complimentary wine while you wait! Doesn't get much better than that :) Staff is nice and food is great (in quantity and taste). I love going every time!
author: meesh m.

description:
i had the most enjoyable dining experience of my life tonight at pacific cafe. 
so, my roommate and i were looking for a place where we could take our other roommate out for his birthday. something not pretentious, but nice. something with seafood, but not ridiculous crap we've never heard. something cozy. we settled on the pacifc cafe because 1. it looked so cute when we drove by it. 2. i yelped it and there were more good reviews than bad, and 3. i heard about the free wine (c'mon i'm only human).
our adventure started at about 830p when we walked in to find that only 3 couples were ahead of us in line. a very cute and unpretentious boy immediately brought us full glasses of wine and we waited in a very cozy sitting area chatting and talking about the day. it was great. even though the restaurant was filled, we could still hear each other. about 15 minutes later, our name is called and we are seated in this little alcove next to a window at a nice round table that is already stocked with bread and tons of butter. they must be stalking. i never get that much butter and i'm a butter fiend and so is my roommate. we would jello wrestle over the last stick if we had to, but!!! we didn't have to because the server was more than happy to keep bringin us basketfulls of bread and all the butter we could gorge ourselves on. 
the menu was all seafood oriented (duh!) with choices that weren't the normal seafood joint fair (for example, my roommate had never heard of turbot and he eats fish... ALOT) so it was a nice surprise for my roomies.  we decided upon the calamari, ahi tuna, filet of sole newburg, and the turbot baked in parchment. EVERYTHING was delicious and cooked to perfect. nothing tasted "sea fishy". my ahi tuna was like a rare steak and the wasabi butter was just spicey enough to get kicked in the teeth with but not enough to where i couldnt eat. we ate everything but didnt stop there! oh no.... we had mango sorbet and tirimasu for dessert!!! the mango sorbet was like literally eating a fresh mango. it was soooooooooo good. and the tirimasu? i would take a bullet for it. 
so as you can see by my long ass review (and if you have even made it this far) i super enjoyed my 2 hour long meal at the pacific cafe. if you drive by and see me in the window, honk and wave, because i'll be there ALLL night.
author: Aly L.

description: i live near here, so i go there if i haven't been eating fish. the food's pretty good and somewhat consistent and the servers are funny. waiting can be a bitch, maybe that's why they give you complimentary house wine. you have to try their clam chowder and seafood bisque.
author: Connie L.

description: Food's OK, but the decor looks like the Regal Beagle from Three's Company. Shrimp scampi is very good, but rich. Oyster cocktail is horrible. Be warned. Good sourdough bread. Free wine is watered down piss water.
author: Olivia B.

description: we have been twice. the first time we went we had a delicious dinner; crab cakes and the halibut parmesan coupled with clam chowder and a yummy shrimp louie salad. it was delecious!  we felt that that prices were fair too average around $25/per person (included a glass of wine and soup/salad) we went back last night and thought we'd try something else. i had the ahi with wasabi butter which was very bland. no taste at all.  my husband had the sole stuffed with crab which  tasted like mush. we were pretty disappointed in both dishes..which makes me wonder if anything else is good besides the crab cakes and halibut. you can't experiment with different dishes at this place. stick to what is known to be excellent and you'll have a nice dinner.
author: SF Native M.

description: Had the totally best night there when I ran out of gas and had to go in to use the head, and lo and behold, my first boyfriend was in there, and we reconnected over a really incredible plate of Sea Bass.  The service was discreet and fluid, the food was cooked to perfection (especially the really crunchy fries with mayo), and the ambience was mellow and cool.  I know this will always be our special place from here to eternity.  A very romantic restaurant!
author: Jeff C.

description: No reservations taken but the free wine while you wait more then makes up for the wait. I've been here countless times and have yet to be disappointed. The average wait is usually 30 to 40 minutes but the fresh sea food is definitely worth it.
author: Benzee B.

description:
going to pacific cafe kinda makes me feel like i am a skip hop and a jump away from dawson's creek. yes. the tv show. you know...that whole cape cod-like feeling? well for the record i have never been to cape cod and maybe i should have paid better attention to dawson's creek because i'm not quite sure if that's even where that show took place. 
but i digress. back to pacific cafe! so close to home! i have only been here about 3 times because it's a little pricey for my budget (more of a "congrats" "happy anniversary" "happy mother's day" kind of meal) but i really like it! it's tiny and nookish ( i just made that word up)
but if you get there too close to dinner time, the wait is forever...and this could be dangerous because they give you free wine while you wait (if you're a cheap drunk like me). 
anyways- i really liked the salmon. and the bread and butter...it's been awhile, i can't remember what else is on the menu, but i think it's pretty seasonal since it's fresh seafood.
although it could be done, i wouldn't really recommend a big group for this place, just because i think it would annoy the other patrons and the place is kinda tiny. take your girlfriend! or your mom!
author: Lori J.

description: It's not that it's good, because don't be fooled, this is a second rate seafood joint...it's that it's a real landmark which has gone unchanged. It looks the same, the menu is the same, and that's just how I hope it stays.  It's really not worth the lines, even if they do give you all that free wine (a tradition I love!) but it's worth the experience for a family outing. DISCLAIMER:  I do feel the need to add that everyone in my party felt sickish the next day.  The fish wasn't fresh.
author: BJS ..

description: very cozy place and a definite treasure in the outer richmond. i would recommend it to anyone although it is more than the average chinese food =) the greatest incentive is a free glass of wine for everyone everyday =)
author: Rosa K.

description: This place is AWFUL!  The seafood is NOT FRESH, the waits are ridiculous and the free wine is practically undrinkable.  I live near here and have been many times, thinking it must have gotten better or maybe I was exagerrating how bad it was last time, but each time I am reminded that it is a mystery why people like this spot.
author: Stacey N.

description: about as good as seafood gets unless you prefer very fru fru obnoxious food. the soups are fantastic, food is served hot and the staff is not lingering at the table. i have noticed that service slips a bit late in the evening. if they prefer to close they should.
author: Mr G.

description: I have been to this restaurant dozens of times, even though I have never lived anywhere near it (way out on Geary, near the Cliff House). It's a cozy little old-school seafood place, with a moderate selection of primarily fish items on the menu. Being that I'm not a white fish fan in general, I get the salmon every single time I go, and I always enjoy it. I'd recommend choosing the french fries as the side, because they are super-thick homemade jobbers, that taste delicious when dipped into the tartar sauce. Yummm.  The main thing for me about this restaurant though, is not it's food. It's that it's so popular, and the seating is so limited (maybe 12 booths?) that there is always a wait outside. And the wait can be long. I've waited over an hour many times, and have probably waited for almost two hours, more than once. And although this might seem INSANE to some (especially since depending on the season, the fog and wind can be intensely bone-chilling out there!) -- the thing that makes it so acceptable is how the hostess keeps coming outside, pouring free glasses of house Chardonnay. So the longer you wait, the more you drink, and the less you care about how long you've been out there, or how brutal each gust of wind might be on your exposed fingers, as you clutch the stem of your wine glass. It's actually a real bonding experience with the folks that you are eating out with, as you huddle on the sidewalk, waiting for your name to be called. I've been part of some great conversations out there, that can get more and more interesting, with each sip of wine. And then FINALLY, when our name is called -- I invariably have to carefully stabilize myself by touching the tops of the booths as I make my way back to our seats... making certain that I don't do a loopy fall into the aisle, before dinner is even served. And at the end... after I've enjoyed my salmon and french fries... my head will have cleared, and I'll be all warm and full and will have completely forgotten about the near-Arctic earlier waiting experience, and will only have happy thoughts about what a wonderful restaurant this truly is.
author: Zoe H.

description: My bf took me to dinner here for our anniversary. I loved that they serve free wine while you wait in line. For someone like me though, who is a total light weight it isn't so good as I was drunk by my second glass (they aren't shy about refills) since I had nothing in my stomach and we waited for an hour (they don't take reservations). Luckily I didn't embaress myself too much. Anyway the food itself was ok, I had "spicy" snapper, which was clearly just seasoned with bit of cajun spices and grilled. Simple, and spicy but since snapper isn't that flavorful, kind of boring, I would have preferred a sauce. It was served with thick cut fries which were more like potatoes. The bf had crab cakes which he liked and I thought were ok, a bit too mayoie for me. However we both had the salmon bisque and it was fabulous! it had a nice kick to it and I could have had another bowl. For desert we had the chocolate mousse cake which really wasn't mousse like at all, it was just a super rich dense chocolate cake. The food was brought out very quickly and service was somewhat short, I imagine they want to turn tables over as quickly as possible. Overall it seems they are going for a simple preparation and presentation, which is good for some items but not all. I did have a nice evening though so I would have given pacific 4 stars, but it would have been based more on the company, which isn't quite fair, so three it is.
author: Meg L.

description: awesome, cozy, romantic, first date restaurant.  fresh fish, some wine and very good company...this place leaves nice memories in  my salt water filled head.
author: Jaclyn L.

description: This restaurant is alright. They offer free wine while you wait and the seafood is not bad. Actually the wait is crazy there and you do get a lot of wine. It's a good place to go every once in a while.
author: Erica K.

description: This place is a true find.  The fish is always fresh and even if you have to wait a while for a table (the restaurant is pretty small), you won't mind because you've got plenty of wine to keep you company!  If you're going on a weekend night be prepared to wait at least an hour.  I always get the petrale sole here and am never disappointed.  The wait staff is friendly and service here is always pretty good.   It is definitely worth a  drive to the OUTER Richmond to check this place out!
author: L V.

description: I didn't see what all of the hype was about. Yea they gave me a glass of wine while I waited for a table, but my server was not all that friendly, and the food was nothing special. Yes, they buy good quality seafood, but the menu was very standard and boring. I thought my dinner ould have been prepared at home by a novice chef.
author: ajwest f.

description: This place is awesome! The ordering process is quick and everything is fresh. We have eaten here countless times! There is sometimes a wait but always worth it; especially when they keep your wine glass full complimentary until you are seated.
author: Brooke P.

description: You put your name down on the clipboard get your complimentary glass of wine and mingle with the other seafood lovers on the sidewalk it could be a cold and lengthy wait. Pacific Cafe is a cozy local's hangout that serves only the freshest seafood.  There is a large specials board with the evening's offerings that will guarantee you're in for a delicious meal.  When you finally nab a table with your complimentary wine in hand, you'll find fresh cut lemons on the table and a basket of incredibly fresh Boudin Sourdough with enough butter to get you well on your way to a heart-attack.  All seafood entres included a cup of soup (never tried it) or a choice of house salads (choose the Louie w/bay shrimps practically a meal in itself). As for entres there are many to recommend but if the Grilled (scampi sized) Prawns are on the menu.....ORDER THEM!  The wait-staff is very friendly as are the other patrons that you'll be spending quality time with on the sidewalk.  So if you have a craving for the Freshest Fish at a reasonable price head to Pacific Caf, you won't be disappointed.
author: toni u.

description: Love this place. Fresh fish simple and not overcooked.  Even without the copious amounts of free wine the place would be worth the wait.
author: Alexa W.

description: The only reason Pac Caf gets 4 stars is because I think their sides are a bit boring. Albeit, I love their rice - and it's not that anything tastes bad - the broccoli is cooked perfect and the potatoes are seasoned well, they're just a bit boring in comparison to the city they live in. Having said that, I think that's the restaurants point. They pride themselves on simplicities, and they're great at it. The fish is absolutely amazing. My boyfriend gets the Parmesan Halibut every time, and I swear every time it's a little better! I myself vary, but if I can recommend anything it is the fried scallops. You've never tasted anything so simple yet so delicate! It's just the best seafood, and I'm promising you that you will not find better service anywhere in this whole city. After the first time in (we live 1 block away) Frank new our faces and our names. You must converse with this man! He's been everywhere, knows everything and is just plain old pleasant. The other server, a woman, seems to be the same way but in the...maybe 5-10 times I've been there Frank has been my server. Free (albeit boxed and fairly poor) wine until you're seated, or even while you eat if you ask, which honestly after a lemon wedge and a carefree attitude is pretty perfect for a weekend. I just flat out love this place.
author: Angie M.

description: yeah it's cheap wine, but it's FREE!!!! sure the wait is long, but there's FREE wine. gimmick? absolutely, but it worked on me! food quality is inconsistent, but when it's good, it's GOOOOOOOOD! the parmesan halibut is one of my favorites. not a crazy selection, but what's there is good. it's a local place with a local feel to it. it's not a fancy-schmancy place, but that's what's good about it. you can come as you are and have some good food and cheap free wine. i'll admit, i've waited forever sometimes and have gone in wasted. that's not a bad thing, is it?
author: armand t.

description: Love this place.  Solid menu, nice stuff, and free cheap wine!
author: Anastasia V.

description: Very nice local neighborhood spot for fresh reasonably proced seafood.  This place has been around 30 plus years.  All the wine you can drink while you wait (which can be long at busy times).  Service is very friendly as well.
author: JERRY D.

description: My husband and I had dinner here on Tuesday the 26th.  I must add, it was to say the least, delightful.  Cozy atmosphere, great service, delicious food, and great prices.  I must admit though, I did give my left overs to the adorable homeless kitties that live behind the restaurant.  We were staying in a hotel and had no where to heat them up anyway.
author: Bethlehem P.

description: Great seafood and free wine! I will say that again because that does not happen often, and even more rarely do restaurants that offer the free wine while you wait check up with you while you are waiting to keep your glass full. Also, the seafood is some of the best if not the best, but i will allude to Citizen Kane and leave with one word to sum up this whole experience: CRAB CAKES(Alright two, give me a break).
author: Nick U.

description:
This place is very, very good and exactly as advertised.  The decor's nothing special at all (doesn't pretend to be), but the service is very efficient and friendly and the food is very high quality and fresh.  They have excellent staples on the menu and the daily fresh fish options are plentiful and are always top notch.  With every entree ($14-22 typically) you get a choice of fries/rice (I always go for the rice, which is very good) and a soup/salad (the salads are caesar or shrimp louie - the latter is very good for a gratis side salad).  You will, however, invariably wait a long time for a table...this place is very popular.  The couple of times I've been here, I've had to wait between 40-60 mins.  But they do offer you free red/white wine (mediocre, but not bad) while you wait, which is a nice gesture.  A quick tip - if you're willing to eat dinner towards the end of the night (8:30-9:00'ish), the wait will be much shorter, if at all.  My wife and I went just last night, and by the time we were finishing (around 8:45'ish), they were seating people right away, and still giving them a free glass of wine!

Bottom line - if you want a good piece of fish, some free wine while you wait, and don't want to pay an arm and a leg, this place is an absolute institution that caters to those needs.  And if they have the crab bisque, get it!
author: Mike L.

description: Four stars, but not sure why it's not five. Great food (have the crab cakes), good atmosphere, good service, little bit of a wait, but, FREE wine while you wait? Can't beat that. If it wasn't so busy all the time, it would be a five.
author: Brian R.
